criteria: Understanding of Rational Expressions as a System
Ability to Add and Subtract Rational Expressions
Ability to Multiply and Divide Rational Expressions
descriptions: Student does not demonstrate understanding that rational expressions form a system analogous to rational numbers.
Student shows a limited understanding that rational expressions form a system analogous to rational numbers.
Student shows some understanding that rational expressions form a system analogous to rational numbers, but struggles to explain the analogy.
Student demonstrates a general understanding that rational expressions form a system analogous to rational numbers.
Student demonstrates a clear understanding that rational expressions form a system analogous to rational numbers, providing a good explanation of the analogy.
Student demonstrates a thorough understanding that rational expressions form a system analogous to rational numbers, providing insightful explanations and examples of the analogy.
Student cannot add or subtract rational expressions.
Student attempts to add or subtract rational expressions but makes significant errors.
Student can add or subtract simple rational expressions but struggles with more complex problems.
Student can generally add and subtract rational expressions with some errors.
Student can add and subtract rational expressions with few errors.
Student can add and subtract rational expressions accurately and efficiently.
Student cannot multiply or divide rational expressions.
Student attempts to multiply or divide rational expressions but makes significant errors.
Student can multiply or divide simple rational expressions but struggles with more complex problems.
Student can generally multiply and divide rational expressions with some errors.
Student can multiply and divide rational expressions with few errors.
Student can multiply and divide rational expressions accurately and efficiently.
Student does not understand the concept of closure under addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
Student shows limited understanding of the concept of closure.
Student understands the concept of closure but cannot apply it to rational expressions.
Student generally understands closure and can apply it to some rational expressions.
Student demonstrates a good understanding of closure and can apply it to rational expressions.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of closure and can explain why rational expressions are closed under the given operations.
